refnamediv.refpurpose: The visual properties of the spacecraft

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The spacecraft visualization properties lets you define a spacecraft model, translate the spacecraft in X,Y, Z directions or apply a fixed rotation to the attitude orientation of the model. You can also adjust the scale factor of the spacecraft model size. Spacecraft visualization properties can be configured either through GMAT’s GUI or the script interface.

refsection.title: GUI
refsection.para: The figure above shows the default settings for the Spacecraft Visualization properties resource

The GUI interface for spacecraft visualization properties is contained on the Visualization tab of the Spacecraft resource. You can configure visualization properties of the spacecraft and visualize the changes in the Display window.

Within the Display window, you can left click and drag your mouse to change camera orientation. Camera orientation can be changed in Up/Down/Left/Right directions. You can also right click and drag your mouse to zoom in and out of the Display window. Moving the cursor in Left/Right or Up/Down directions helps to zoom in and out of the Display window.

refsection.title: Configuring Spacecraft Visualization properties
refsection.para: GMAT lets you define any spacecraft model but currently GMAT supports only .3ds model format. The following two websites list many .3ds spacecraft model formats: http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/3d_resources/models.html & http://www.celestiamotherlode.net/. Most of these models are in .3ds format, which can be read by most 3D programs.

GMAT lets you apply fixed rotation to the attitude orientation of the spacecraft model or translate the model in any of the X, Y and Z directions. You can also apply a scale factor to the selected spacecraft model to adjust the size of the model. Any changes that are made to the spacecraft model, attitude orientation, translation or scale size factor will also be displayed in OrbitView resource’s graphics window. The configured spacecraft visualization properties will only show up in OrbitView graphics window after you have run the mission. See OrbitView resource’s user-specification document to learn more about OrbitView graphics window.
